content: The "Citizen Empowerment Act" may be cited as the official title. Part III of title 5, United States Code, is amended by adding a new chapter 79A for services to members of the public. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" establishes procedures for in-person and telephonic interactions by executive branch employees regarding possible violations of federal statutes or regulations. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" defines official interactions between executive agency employees and individuals regarding potential violations of federal laws, which could lead to fines, penalties, or tax collection. It also clarifies the terms "State" and "telephonic." The "Citizen Empowerment Act" defines official interactions between executive agency employees and individuals for potential violations of federal laws. It clarifies the terms "State" as each State, the District of Columbia, and any commonwealth, territory, or possession of the United States, and "telephonic" as communication by telephone or similar electronic device. The Act allows individuals to make audio recordings of interactions at their own expense and with their own equipment. Individuals can make audio recordings of covered interactions at their own expense and with their own equipment. Federal employees conducting covered interactions may also record them if they inform the individual beforehand and provide a transcript or copy upon request, with reimbursement from the individual.
